Description.Title: SoilTemperatureSWAT model
Description.ExtendedDescription: Strategy implementing the SWAT method to compute soil temperature by layers. It updates daily layer temperatures using a lag coefficient and an exponential depth-damping function driven by soil profile depth, bulk density, volumetric water content, layer thickness, and the annual mean air temperature. Based on Neitsch et al., SWAT Theoretical Documentation (Version 2000).
Description.ShortDescription: Soil temperature by layers computed with the SWAT method using a lag and depth-damping approach.

Input.name: LagCoefficient
Input.description: Lag coefficient controlling influence of previous day's temperature

Input.name: states_SoilTemperatureByLayers
Input.description: Previous day's soil temperature by layer

Input.name: states_VolumetricWaterContent
Input.description: Volumetric soil water content by layer

Output.name: states_SoilTemperatureByLayers
Output.description: Updated soil temperature by layer after step

Function.name: Init
Function.description: Initializes states_SoilTemperatureByLayers to 15 degC for each soil layer.

Function.name: Estimate
Function.description: Main biophysical process computing soil temperature by layers using the SWAT method.
